result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mathew James Visger

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing

10:39 AM Defendant Mathew James Visger in court, in custody from TC Jail.  Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee in court for Mathew James Visger.  Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def wishes to waive right to PH. Court advised def right to PH. Def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for further proceedings. Information filed. ARGN set. Bond to continue.
Arraignment scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:04 PM Defendant Mathew James Visger appeared by video, in custody from the TC Jail.  Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee appeared by video for Mathew James Visger.  Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim(s) appears by video and phone. Defense makes argument for bond modification. State advised with victim input, believes bond should remain set as is, makes argument. Victim makes statement. Court denies motion to modify bond. Bond to cont.
Motion to Modify Bond
Print Card Shredded

Defendant to have no contact with J.V., their residence, place of employment or any place they occupy. Defendant to have no contact with minor children except as approved by Trempealeau County Department of Human Services. Defendant to have no contact with J.V.'s immediate family members or their residences. Defendant not to possess or consume alcohol and is not to enter bars or taverns, or any place where alcohol is sold or served for on-premises consumption. Defendant is not to possess any firearms. Defendant to have no contact with C.D.B. or their residence.

9:46 AM Defendant Mathew James Visger appeared by video, in custody from the TC Jail.  Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee appeared by phone for Mathew James Visger.  Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim(s) appear by phone. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant waives reading of complaint. Defendant KVI waives time limits to PH. PH set. State request to amend bond, makes argument. Defense has no objection. Court amends bond conditions. Defense requests to reduce bond, makes argument. Court advised needs to file motion to modify bond for victim notification. BBH set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
